meanings.definition: The study or detailed description of the surface features of a region.
meanings.sent1: In geography class, we learned about the different topographies of the Earth.
meanings.sent2: The map displayed the topographies of the mountain ranges and rivers.
meanings.sent3: The topographies of the land seemed to tell a story of its own.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a complex topography of memories and emotions.
meanings.sent5: The topographies of the landscape were etched in his mind like a detailed painting.

meanings.definition: The physical features of a place or region.
meanings.sent1: The diverse topographies of the national park attracted many visitors.
meanings.sent2: The topographies of the desert included sand dunes and rocky outcrops.
meanings.sent3: The topographies of the cityscape made it a unique and vibrant place.
meanings.sent4: His face bore the topographies of a life well-lived.
meanings.sent5: The topographies of the coastline were breathtaking, with cliffs and sandy beaches.

meanings.definition: The arrangement of natural and artificial physical features of an area.
meanings.sent1: The urban planner considered the topographies of the city when designing the new park.
meanings.sent2: The topographies of the garden included paths, ponds, and sculptures.
meanings.sent3: The topographies of the playground made it a fun and exciting place for children.
meanings.sent4: The topographies of the room changed as furniture was rearranged.
meanings.sent5: The topographies of the park were carefully planned to create a harmonious environment.
